goal.en: Many physical phenomena, engineering, and economic problems can be mathematically described using ordinary or partial differential equations. However, these types of problems often cannot be solved analytically using mathematical methods and require various numerical methods to obtain their numerical approximate solutions. This course explores how to use numerical methods to solve ordinary differential equations or partial differential equations. This course will discuss various numerical methods to compute numerical solutions for multiple problems. These problems traditionally include initial-value problems, boundary-value problems, mixed problems (initial and boundary-value problems), and elliptic and parabolic partial differential equation problems. The course content will also introduce several commonly used numerical methods, such as the finite difference method. For each numerical method, the course will cover the derivation of their convergence rate and stability analysis to assess the strengths and weaknesses of each technique.
